CCC RightsLink

External Resources

On this page

CCC RightsLink ​

Purchase Process Overview ​

Overview ​

Copyright Clearance Center (CCC) RightsLink is an online licensing platform that enables quick purchase of permissions from participating publishers.

Key Benefits ​

BenefitDescription
SpeedInstant license generation
ConvenienceOnline 24/7 availability
ClarityClear pricing upfront
DocumentationAutomatic license records

When to Use RightsLink ​

Ideal Scenarios ​

  • Publisher participates in RightsLink
  • Standard usage terms acceptable
  • Timeline is urgent
  • Price is within budget

Not Recommended When ​

  • Custom terms needed
  • Bulk discount desired
  • Price seems excessive
  • Publisher prefers direct contact

Using RightsLink ​

Step-by-Step Process ​

  1. Navigate to www.copyright.com
  2. Search by title, DOI, or ISBN
  3. Select the specific content
  4. Choose reuse type and scope
  5. Review terms and price
  6. Purchase using company account
  7. Download license confirmation

Search Options ​

MethodBest For
TitleBooks, general search
DOIJournal articles
ISBNBook chapters
ISSNJournal issues
AuthorWhen DOI unknown

Reuse Types ​

TypeDescription
Republish in a bookInclude in new publication
Republish in journalJournal article reuse
Academic/educationalTeaching materials
DigitalOnline publication
PrintPhysical publication
Print + DigitalCombined rights

Pricing Factors ​

What Affects Cost ​

FactorImpact
PublisherEach sets own prices
Content TypeFigures vs. text varies
Usage ScopeWorld vs. regional
DurationTime-limited vs. perpetual
FormatPrint, digital, or both
CommercialHigher than educational

Pricing Notes ​

  • Prices vary significantly by publisher
  • Price displayed as "PRICE: Pending" until selection is complete
  • Currency selection: USD - $
  • Use SAVE QUOTE button to save pricing for review

Account Management ​

Setting Up Account ​

  1. Create CCC account (free)
  2. Link to company billing
  3. Set up approval workflows
  4. Configure notifications

Company Account Features ​

FeaturePurpose
Central billingConsolidated invoicing
Approval workflowSpending controls
Usage reportsTrack purchases
Saved searchesEfficiency

Documentation ​

License Certificate ​

Each purchase generates:

  • License number
  • Content identification
  • Terms of use
  • Credit line requirements
  • Validity period

Record Keeping ​

  1. Download PDF license
  2. Attach to RPC item
  3. Note license number
  4. Record cost and terms

Participating Publishers ​

Major Publishers on RightsLink ​

PublisherCoverage
Springer NatureMost content
WileyExtensive
ElsevierInternal use varies
Taylor & FrancisMost journals
SAGEGood coverage
ACSFull coverage
IEEEConference/journals

Finding Participation ​

Not all content is available:

  1. Search the specific item
  2. If not found, contact publisher directly
  3. Some publishers have own portals

Best Practices ​

Before Purchasing ​

  1. Verify exact content needed
  2. Confirm usage scope matches needs
  3. Compare to direct publisher pricing
  4. Check if bulk discount available
  5. Get approval if needed

Documentation ​

  • Screenshot search results
  • Save confirmation email
  • Download license PDF
  • Update RPC immediately

Cost Management ​

TipBenefit
Batch requestsPotential discounts
Check alternativesMay find lower cost
Review termsAvoid over-licensing
Track spendingBudget management

Troubleshooting ​

Common Issues ​

IssueSolution
Content not foundTry different search terms, contact publisher
Price seems wrongClear cart, search again
License not receivedCheck spam, contact CCC
Wrong terms selectedContact CCC support

CCC Support ​

  • Website - copyright.com/support
  • Email - info@copyright.com
  • Phone - 978-750-8400

Integration with Workflow ​

From Permission Request to RightsLink ​

  1. Receive permission request in RPC
  2. Research indicates RightsLink available
  3. Complete RightsLink purchase
  4. Document in RPC with license details
  5. Close item as Granted

When RightsLink Doesn't Work ​

If RightsLink fails:

  • Content not available → Contact publisher
  • Price too high → Negotiate directly
  • Terms inadequate → Request custom license
  • Technical error → Try again or contact CCC
